reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Nicaragua joined together for a sustainable national response in the reduction of tuberculosis and mortality with emphasis on vulnerable populations and based on family and community health model

description.narrative: Nicaragua - Tuberculosis. This program has the following goals: Reduce the TB burden at 25% by 2020 // Reducir la Carga de TB en 25% al 2020. Reduce the TB mortality rate in 35% by 2020 // Reducir la mortalidad de TB en 35% al 2020. The objectives of this program are: Contribute to the prevention and integrated TB care focusing on people affected by Tuberculosis // Contribuir en la prevención y la atención integrada de la TB centrada en personas afectadas por Tuberculosis. Strengthen the political commitment , the capacity of the National Program , communities , social organizations, public and private providers in prevention, care and TB control // Fortalecer el compromiso político, la capacidad del Programa Nacional, las comunidades, organizaciones sociales y proveedores público privados en la prevención, atención y control de la TB. Contribute to operational, epidemiological and clinical research, implementation of initiatives and new technologies of rapid diagnostics for tuberculosis control // Contribuir con la investigación operativa, epidemiológica y clínica, implementación de iniciativas y nuevas tecnologías de diagnósticos rápidos para el control de la tuberculosis

title.narrative: Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
